data.name: CopyRawMetadataFailedErrorMessage
data.value: Failed to copy metadata to your clipboard. Save to a file instead?
data.comment: Shown when the copy to clipboard operation fails. The text should prompt the user if they'd like to save the data to a file instead.

data.name: CopyRawMetadataFailedErrorTitle
data.comment: Shown when the copy to clipboard operation fails.

data.name: FieldListGenerationError
data.value: Something went wrong while generating the field list.
data.comment: Generic error shown when the field list in the field selection dialog cannot be rendered for some reason

data.name: FileAssociationFailedErrorMessageFormat
data.value: Something went wrong (Error code: {0}). Try running ParquetViewer as administrator and try again.
data.comment: Shown when file association fails in the Help page

data.name: FileAssociationFailedErrorTitle
data.comment: Shown when file association fails in the Help page

data.name: GenericErrorMessage
data.comment: Generic message preceding an actual error message

data.name: InvalidDateFormatErrorMessage
data.value: Invalid date format. Please refer to the documentation for valid date format specifiers.
data.comment: Shown in the custom date format dialog when the user tries to save an invalid date

data.name: InvalidDateFormatErrorTitle
data.comment: Shown in the custom date format dialog when the user tries to save an invalid date

data.name: InvalidQueryErrorTitle
data.comment: Shown when the user inputs an invalid filter query and clicks Execute

data.name: MetadataReadErrorMessage
data.value: Something went wrong while reading the file's metadata.
data.comment: Shown if the metadata viewer fails to read the metadata of a file

data.name: MetadataReadErrorTitle
data.comment: Shown if the metadata viewer fails to read the metadata of a file

data.name: NestedListOfTypeNotSupportedMessageFormat
data.comment: Tooltip text shown in the field selection dialog when hovering the cursor over an unsupported field. Example: "Lists of Maps are...", "Map of Structs...", "Struct of Lists"..., etc.

data.name: NoFieldsFoundErrorMessage
data.value: The selected file/folder doesn't have any fields.
data.comment: Shown when the parquet file contains no fields

data.name: NoFieldsFoundErrorTitle
data.comment: Shown when the parquet file contains no fields

data.name: NoFieldsSelectedErrorMessage
data.comment: Thrown in the unlikely scenario where the user was able to attempt to load a file without selecting any fields to load

data.name: NoThriftMetadataAvailableErrorMessage
data.comment: Fallback error just in case something goes catastrophically wrong while fetching metadata

data.name: OpenFileNoLongerExistsErrorMessageFormat
data.value: The specified file/folder no longer exists: {0}Please try opening a new file or folder.
data.comment: Shown in the unlikely event where the open file(s) were somehow deleted

data.name: ParquetSchemaReadErrorMessage
data.comment: Generic error shown when ParquetViewer is unable to read the schema of a parquet file

data.name: SelectAtLeastOneFieldErrorMessage
data.value: Please select at least one field
data.comment: Shown when the user tries to close the field selection dialog without selecting any fields

data.name: SelectAtLeastOneFieldErrorTitle
data.comment: Shown when the user tries to close the field selection dialog without selecting any fields

data.name: StructWithUnsupportedFieldErrorMessageFormat
data.comment: Tooltip text shown in the field selection dialog when hovering the cursor over an unsupported struct field

data.name: TooManyColumnsXlsErrorMessageFormat
data.value:
The .xls file format supports a maximum of {0} columns.
Please try another file format or reduce the amount of columns you are exporting. Your columns: {1}
data.comment: Shown when the user tries to export data to an xls file that has too many columns

data.name: TooManyColumnsErrorTitle
data.comment: Shown when the user tries to export data to an xls file that has too many columns

data.name: TooManyColumnsXlsxErrorMessageFormat
data.value:
The .xlsx file format supports a maximum of {0} columns.
Please try another file format or reduce the amount of columns you are exporting. Your columns: {1}
data.comment: Shown when the user tries to export data to an xlsx file that has too many columns

data.name: UnknownFieldTypeErrorMessage
data.comment: Fallback error message for a field type that isn't supported

data.name: UnsupportedExportType
data.comment: Fallback error that is thrown if the user tries to export to a file extension we don't recognize.

data.name: ExportFailedErrorTitle
data.comment: Shown when an exception is encountered during a file export

data.name: NoValidParquetFilesFoundErrorMessage
data.value: No valid parquet files found in folder. Invalid parquet files:
data.comment: Shown when the user tries to open a folder and all found parquet files are invalid

data.name: SomeInvalidParquetFilesFoundErrorMessage
data.value: Some files could not be loaded. Invalid Parquet files:
data.comment: Shown when the user tries to open a folder and some of the found parquet files are invalid

data.name: UnexpectedFileReadErrorMessageFormat
data.comment: Shown when we can't open a parquet file and we don't know why.

data.name: MultipleSchemasDetectedErrorMessage
data.comment: Shown when the user tries to open a folder containing parquet files with different schemas

data.name: MalformedFieldErrorMessageFormat
data.value:
{0}
If you think the file is valid please consider opening an issue in the GitHub repo. See: Help → About
data.comment: Shown to users when ParquetViewer fails to read a specific field. It should prompt the user to open a bug ticket if they believe the file is valid

data.name: DecimalValueTooLargeErrorTitle
data.comment: Shown when a field contains decimal values outside the supported range for .NET

data.name: DecimalValueTooLargeErrorMessageFormat
data.value: Field `{0}` with type DECIMAL({1}, {2}) contains values outside ParquetViewer's supported range between DECIMAL({3}, {4}) and DECIMAL({3}, 0)
data.comment: Shown when a field contains decimal values outside the supported range for .NET

data.name: MultipleSchemasDetectedEntriesErrorMessageFormat
data.comment: Shown when the user tries to open a folder containing parquet files with different schemas

data.name: CopyAsWhereTooLargeErrorMessage
data.value: The selected data is too large. Please select less cells.
data.comment: Shown when the user right-click's on too many cells and selects the Copy as WHERE... option

data.name: CopyAsWhereTooLargeErrorTitle
data.comment: Shown when the user right-click's on too many cells and selects the Copy as WHERE... option

data.name: InvalidQueryErrorMessage
data.value: The query doesn't seem to be valid. Please try again.
data.comment: Thrown when an invalid query is executed

data.name: UnexpectedAssemblyVersionErrorFormat
data.value: An unexpected assembly version was encountered: {0}
data.comment: Thrown in the rare case the executable has a non semantic version number
